item.title: Configuring Calibre Server from CLI
item.description:
Watching

Installing on a FreeBSD Jail Link to heading

Very easy to do on FreeBSD 11.3 via the FreeNAS GUI.

  1. Create a new jail and set a specific IPv4 address to host. For me, this was 192.168.5.33
  2. Enter into a shell within the jail and run pkg install calibre

FreeBSD will ask if we want to download and set up the package manager, which we do. After that, it’ll install a lot of packages (Python 3.7, some Perl, etc.) and then all CLI commands should be available.

item.title: Linux Virtual Monitors with xrandr
item.description:
I recently learned that you can configure virtual monitors with xrandr. There are two different ways to use this: treat multiple physical monitors as one giant virtual monitor or treat one physical monitor as multiple virtual monitors.

Note that this requires xrandr 1.5.0 or higher, which introduces setmonitor as an option in the CLI.

Why do I want to do this? Link to heading

My primary interest here is to split a super widescreen monitor like the Dell 49" UltraSharp Curved Monitor (U4919DW) as multiple separate displays. I like the way that dwm breaks up monitors into multiple spaces and when I have two or three separate monitors I normally use a center monitor for focused work with the side monitors containing music, calendar, and chat.

item.title: Proxmox Changes
item.description:
Removing subscription notice Link to heading 

sed -i.bak 's/NotFound/Active/g' /usr/share/perl5/PVE/API2/Subscription.pm && systemctl restart pveproxy.service

Generating Let’s Encrypt certs Link to heading

https://pve.proxmox.com/wiki/HTTPS_Certificate_Configuration_(Version_4.x_and_newer)#Let.27s_Encrypt_using_acme.sh

Supporting port 80 & 443 Link to heading

By default, proxmox looks for traffic only on port 8006. Based on my readings online, forcefully changing the port - which is now hardcoded - can cause a lot of problems. Instead, the most recent and successful recommendation has been to use nginx to redirect traffic on port 80 and 443 to port 8006.
